title: Finding Center
text: Identify the center (h,k). The center is halfway between vertices $$(1,1)$$ and $$(11,1)$$. Applying the midpoint formular, we have $$(6,1)$$

title: Solving for $$a^2$$
text: Next, we find $$a^2$$. The length of the transverse axis, 2a, is bounded by ther vertices. So, we can find $$a^2$$ by finding the distance between the x-coordinates of ther vertices so $$a=5$$ and $$a^2=25$$

title: Solving for $$c^2$$
text: Now we need to find $$c^2$$. The coordinates of the foci are (h~c,k). So $$(h+c,k)=(12,1)$$. We can use the x-coordinate from this point to solve for c using $$h=6$$ so $$c=6$$ and $$c^2=36$$

title: Solving for $$b^2$$
text: Next, solve for $$b^2$$ using the equation $$b^2=c^2-a^2=36-25=11$$
speech: Next, solve for  b squared  using the equation  b squared, is equal to, c squared minus a squared, is equal to 36 minus 25, is equal to 11
